articles.name: In-game Features Powered by Discord FAQ
articles.title: In-game Features Powered by Discord FAQ
articles.body:
Discord is partnering with a limited number of game developers to enhance various social and communication features within their games. For players of these games, it means some aspects of their in-game experience (such as in-game voice or friends lists) will be powered by Discord.

Q: Does that mean I need a Discord account to play the game?

A: Players will not be required to connect a Discord account to play the game.

Q: Can I talk to my friends on Discord while playing this game?

A: In some games, players are able to chat with friends across Discord while they’re in-game, even if they’re not playing the same game.

Q: Will this integration affect my game performance?

A: The integrations are designed to avoid impacting game performance.

Q: Does this mean Discord can access all the messages I send in the game?

A: Discord is only able to access messages that the game developers provide access to, in accordance with the privacy policies of both Discord and the game.

Q: What can the game developer do with my data?

A: Refer to the privacy policies of Discord and of the game developer. Game developers are allowed to use messages to support their safety and content moderation efforts and as needed to power the communications experience between Discord and their game.

Note: If you’re running into an issue connecting your Discord account to your game, please reach out to the developer of that game for further assistance. Discord Support is not able to assist.

articles.name: Leaderboards FAQ
articles.title: Leaderboards FAQ
articles.body:
Leaderboards on Discord allows you to share your game/activity/app stats and compete with others in your server. Learn more about how to use Leaderboards in your Discord server!

What this article covers:
    • What Are Leaderboards?
    • How to View Leaderboards
    • How to Join Leaderboards
    • How Leaderboard Competition Works
    • Leaderboard Controls
      • How to Leave a Leaderboard
      • How to Customize Your Server’s Leaderboard

What Are Leaderboards?

Note: This is currently an experimental feature and is only available to a limited number of League of Legends players on desktop (Windows and Mac OS) and browser.

Leaderboards allow users to share their stats for a game, activity or application, and compete against other members in a server.

Leaderboards via the Desktop App

How to View Leaderboards

For servers in the experiment, a Leaderboard will appear on the Recent Activity section of the Member List. 

League of Legends Displayed as Activity Status in Members List

By hovering over the League of Legends activity in the Members List, you can view the Leaderboard for the server and see where everyone ranks.

Selecting a User in the Leaderboard

How to Join Leaderboards

In order to join Leaderboards, you will need to connect your League of Legends account to your Discord account. If you haven’t connected your League of Legends account already, there are two ways to do this.

Connecting Through the Leaderboard

1. With the Leaderboard opened, tap on Join Leaderboard at the bottom and then follow the prompts to connect your League of Legends account to Discord.

“Join Leaderboard” Button in the Leaderboard

Connecting in User Settings

1. Press on the cogwheel [] in the bottom-left corner to access your User Settings .

2. Select Connections and then choose League of Legends to connect your account.

Connections Tab within User Settings

3. After following the prompts, your League of Legends account will be connected to your Discord account. You can learn more about Connections through the Connections & Linked Roles: Community Members Help Center article. 

How Leaderboard Competition Works

Here's everything you need to know to participate and track your progress:

Viewing the Leaderboard
  • Find the leaderboard in the Recent Activity section of the server's members list.
  • Leaderboards are based on various League of Legends stats, including:
    • Wins
    • Kills
    • Damage taken
  • We may introduce additional stats in future updates.
Rank Updates
  • Your stats and rank updates automatically within 30 minutes after each match.
  • Discord fetches your latest match stats to keep the leaderboard current.
Rewards and Recognition
  • The #1 ranked player receives a special icon next to their name in the server.
  • Leaderboards reset weekly, giving everyone a fresh chance to compete.
Sharing Your Achievements
  • Want to showcase your rank? Simply copy a player's rank from the leaderboard.
  • Paste the rank in any text channel to share with the community.

Example of a User’s Ranking

Leaderboard Controls

How to Leave a Leaderboard

You can remove yourself from a server’s leaderboard by tapping on the ellipsis [] and  selecting Leave Leaderboard.

“Leave Leaderboard” Button

How to Customize Your Server’s Leaderboard

Members with the Manage Server permissions enabled can customize how the Leaderboard behaves in the server. 

Manager Server Permission 

1. With the Leaderboard opened, tap on the ellipsis [] and then select Manage Settings. 

Manage Settings Option in Leaderboards

2. There are two ways to customize the leaderboard:

  • Select a different stat as the basis for competition (e.g., kills, deaths, assists, damage taken or dealt, and wins).
  • Disable the role icon in chat.

Leaderboard Settings

articles.name: Best Buy x Discord Nitro Promo
articles.title: Best Buy x Discord Nitro Promo
articles.body:
Starting from November 6, 2024, Best Buy customers can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro from purchasing eligible Best Buy products. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in the US and Puerto Rico where Discord Nitro and eligible Best Buy products are available. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim the promo by purchasing eligible Best Buy products starting November 6, 2024, and redeem it in your Discord account by December 5, 2025.

NOTE: This promo is only available to customers who have purchased Best Buy products with eligible SKUs. 

Membership: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method for per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Best Buy?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Best Buy product?   
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Best Buy?

Best Buy is the world’s largest specialty consumer electronics retailer and provides its customers a unique mix of advice, products and services in Best Buy stores, on BestBuy.com and in homes. Expert associates advise customers on its curated assortment of the latest, name-brand technology, while its highly trained services teams help with designs, consultations, delivery, installation, tech support and repair.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Best Buy product? 

To claim your Nitro promotion, simply purchase an eligible Best Buy product. 

  • For in-store purchases: Look for the Nitro offer code at the bottom of your receipt.
  • For online purchases: Check your email for the Nitro offer code.
NOTE: The Nitro offer code will be provided immediately after your purchase, regardless of whether you buy online or in-store. To receive your code via email, you must have opted into Best Buy's email communications.

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by December 5, 2025.

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is only available in the US and Puerto Rico where Discord Nitro and eligible Best Buy products are available. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

NOTE:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 2 - Claiming your promotion gift

Once you have logged in to your account, head over to your User Settings by selecting the cogwheel [] in the lower right corner. 

While there, select Gift Inventory. 

Then, enter the gift code in the Redeem Code box and press Redeem. You can find your unique gift code on the following: 

  • For in-store purchases: Look for the Nitro offer code at the bottom of your receipt.
  • For online purchases: Check your email for the Nitro offer code.

Afterwards, you will see a message appear below the box stating: “This looks like a promotion code. Click here to redeem.” Press Click here and follow the next prompts to redeem your Nitro promo trial. 

You can share this gift with a friend as long as the promo code has not been redeemed. Once the code is claimed, the account you are currently logged in as will receive this gift and it cannot be transferred to another user. Please ensure you are logged into the correct account before redeeming the gift or sharing the promo code with a friend.

Step 3 - Redeeming your promotion gift

Review the details of the promotion then press on Next. Please note: if you switch to a different account at this step, you will not be able to claim and redeem the promotion on the account you switched to. 

Make sure your payment information is accurate. If your Discord account does not have your payment information, please fill out your payment details. You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the membership renews.

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the confirmation button.

Step 4 - Membership Now Activated

After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro membership on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Best Buy Digital customers can purchase eligible Best Buy products starting on November 6, 2024, and redeem it in your Discord account by December 5, 2025. 

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by December 5, 2025.

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by December 5, 2025, it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion with their Best Buy purchase?

A: To redeem your Nitro promo, simply purchase an eligible Best Buy product. You will find the Nitro promo offer code on the following: 

  • For in-store purchases: Look for the Nitro offer code at the bottom of your receipt.
  • For online purchases: Check your email for the Nitro offer code.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in the US and Puerto Rico where Discord Nitro and eligible Best Buy products are available.This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

NOTE: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: What should I do if I'm experiencing issues with my Best Buy purchase?

A: Log into your MyBBY account to resend the redemption email or press "Redeem Now." If you need further assistance, contact Best Buy support at 1-888-BESTBUY (1-888-237-8289).

articles.name: Nitro 2-Week Trial Offer
articles.title: Nitro 2-Week Trial Offer
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Promotion Summary
    • Eligibility Conditions
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • How do I claim my Nitro Trial?
    • On Desktop/Browser
    • On Mobile
  • Frequently Asked Questions

The power of Nitro is yours with our promotion valid through November 21, 2024! Read below to learn more.

Please make sure your Discord app is updated to the latest version!

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: Eligible users can enjoy a 2-week trial of Discord Nitro on us when you subscribe to Nitro (Monthly or Yearly) on Discord’s desktop, browser, or mobile app.

  • Your trial begins as soon as you sign up for a Nitro plan. You will not be charged until your trial ends.

Eligibility Conditions

  • Discord users who have not had a Nitro subscription in the past 30 days prior to the promotion claim date. 
  • Users on Discord’s desktop, browser, and mobile apps.
  • Users who had an active Nitro subscription (Nitro, Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, including trials) within the 30 days prior to the date they attempted to claim this promotion.
  • Users who received another Nitro trial or discount offer in the past 45 days.  
  • iOS users must also have previously subscribed to Nitro through Apple, but have not subscribed within the past 30 days.

Regional availability: This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you do not see the promotion offer in your app, you are not eligible for this promotion.

Deadline for Claiming Promo: This promotion must be claimed before November 21, 2024 (11:59 PM PT).

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that unlocks a world of perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, and more:

  • Custom & Animated Emojis
  • Custom Profiles
  • HD Streaming
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Special Shop Perks
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

How do I claim my Nitro Trial?

If you’re eligible to claim this Nitro offer, you’ll want to head over to the Nitro Tab.

On Desktop/Browser

Step 1: Go to the Nitro tab

On the desktop or browser app, press the Direct Messages button in the top left corner and then select the Nitro tab. Alternatively, you can navigate to your User Settings > Nitro.

Step 2: Subscribe to Nitro Monthly or Yearly 

Once you are on the Nitro page - press Try 2-Weeks Free and select either the monthly or yearly plan for Nitro.

On the next screen, enter your credit card information and other payment details.

Step 3: Start Your 2-Week Trial

Upon successful completion of sign up, your account will be upgraded to Nitro and your 2-week trial will begin!

Nitro 2-Week Trial Offer on Desktop

On Mobile

1. To get started on mobile, tap on your avatar in the bottom right corner. 

2. Select the Nitro button in the upper right to navigate to the Nitro page. Alternatively, tap the Settings icon and navigate to the Nitro page. 

 

Mobile App: Avatar Icon [Left] and Nitro button [Right] 

3. Sign up for Nitro by tapping the Try 2 Weeks Free. 

NOTE: If you don't have any existing payment methods, you'll be prompted to enter your payment information.

4.  Review the details, then tap Try Nitro for Free to start your trial.

Nitro 2-Week Trial Offer on Mobile

5. Once you've successfully signed up, your trial will begin. 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Why don't I see this offer in my Discord app?

A: If you don't see any promotion details on your Nitro tab across the desktop, browser, or mobile apps, it is because you do not meet the eligibility criteria.

Q: What happens if I have an active Server Boosting subscription?

A: If a user has had a Server Boosting membership active on their account and they have not had a Nitro membership within the last 30 days, redeeming this promotion will replace your original Server Boosting membership with a Nitro membership. You can learn more about Nitro here. 

Please note: if you don’t see the trial on your mobile device, head over to the Nitro page on desktop to check for availability. 

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership, at the end of your 2-week trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro.

However, you can cancel Nitro at any time, including during trial. To cancel Nitro on desktop, head to your User Settings > select Subscriptions > press Cancel within the Nitro banner. These steps may appear slightly different on mobile.  

Please note: You will not be charged until the trial ends and the membership renews. We’ll send an email before the paid membership begins, and you’ll have the opportunity to cancel before you are charged by following the steps here.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a trial?

A: There is no charge for this 2-week Nitro trial. However, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm that the submitted payment method is valid. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

After you redeem the trial offer, we reverse the temporary hold to return the funds, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Please note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

articles.name: HD Splash Potion FAQ
articles.title: HD Splash Potion FAQ
articles.body:
HD Splash Potion allows everyone in a voice channel to enjoy HD video streaming quality for the next 12 hours without Nitro and Server Boosts.

What this article covers:
  • What is the HD Splash Potion?
  • Why and When should I use an HD Splash Potion?
  • How do I purchase an HD Splash Potion?
  • How do I activate and use my HD Splash Potion?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
HD Splash Potions are currently an experimental feature, available only to select desktop users.

What is the HD Splash Potion?

Why, adventurer, you may have stumbled into a curious, new trinket on Discord…

The HD Splash Potion is a new feature that grants the magical properties of crystal-clear HD streaming quality on Discord.

With a single use, you and everyone in a designated voice channel can enjoy crystal-clear HD streaming quality for the next 12 hours - without anyone needing an active Nitro subscription or Server Boosts.

Example of Using an HD Splash Potion 

NOTE: Potion availability and streaming quality may be impacted by the device conditions of participants in the channel.

Why and When should I use the HD Splash Potion?

The HD Splash Potion is perfect for any moment where you and your friends want to enjoy crystal-clear HD streaming quality together at the same time, even when you don’t have server boosts or an active Nitro subscription.

Whether you’re gaming together, hosting a watch-and-hangout session, or studying with others, some examples of popular situations to sip your HD Splash potion could include:

  • Group gaming sessions
  • Watch parties
  • Group gatherings and hangouts
  • Community events like music, art, and talent shows
  • Study sessions and presentations

How do I purchase an HD Splash Potion?

1. To purchase an HD Splash Potion, navigate to the voice channel where you want to apply it.

2. Select the Share Your Screen button and press the HD Streaming Potion option.

3. In the HD Streaming Potion menu, press Buy to confirm your purchase.

NOTE: If you don't have a payment method on file, you'll be prompted to enter your payment information to complete the purchase.
[image/GIF]

How do I activate and use my HD Splash Potion?

You and your friends can enjoy enhanced streaming quality by following these steps:
1. In a voice channel, select the Screen Share [] icon.

Share Your Screen Button in Voice Channel

2. In the Screen Share pop out, locate and select your HD Splash Potion. This channel will become your designated space where your entire squad can enjoy streaming in HD quality together.
Choose a voice channel carefully. The potion’s HD splash effect can’t be moved to a different channel once after it’s activated.

Selecting the HD Splash Potion in Screen Share Menu

3. Once you’re certain of the voice channel, be sure to confirm.

HD Splash Potion Voice Channel Selection and Confirmation: Your first HD Splash Potion is free on us! Afterwards, you can purchase more potions as needed. 

And that’s it! You’ll know you and your squad are enjoying HD streaming quality once you see the HD tag over your streams.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What platforms is the HD Splash Potion available on?

A: Currently, it’s only available on desktop devices.

Q: How much do HD Splash Potions cost?

A: Your first HD Splash Potion is free so you can try it out to see if you like it. After using your free potion, additional HD Splash Potions can be purchased for $0.99 USD each.

Q: Do I need Nitro or server boosts to use an HD Splash Potion?

A: Nope! The HD Splash Potion grants HD streaming quality in a designated channel for a set period of time—for you, your friends, and other server members who have access to that voice channel. No Nitro or server boosts required!

Q: How long does the HD Splash Potion last?

A: Once used, the HD Splash Potion will grant 12 hours of HD streaming quality in the channel where it was activated. Anyone who joins the designated channel will enjoy HD streaming until the potion’s effect expires.

You can still control your streaming quality at any time. For instance, if you notice your device’s performance struggling, you can adjust the streaming quality in the Share Your Screen pop out.

Q: Does everyone in the channel need to have or use a HD Splash Potion to enjoy HD streaming quality?

A: Nope! Just one person needs to use their potion in a designated channel to grant everyone in that channel the ability to benefit from HD streaming quality.

Q: Do I need to be friends with the potion user to receive HD streaming from the potion?

A: Not at all! Once someone uses their HD Splash potion in a channel, anyone can enjoy HD streaming quality in that designated channel, regardless of friendship status.

Q: What happens when the 12 hours are up?

A: Once the time is up, HD streaming quality in the designated channel will return to its standard quality for anyone without an active Nitro subscription.

Q: Can I move the HD Splash effect from my potion to a different channel after I’ve activated it in one channel?

A: Nope. The HD Splash potion will only grant its effect in the channel where it was used. Choose the voice channel carefully before activating the potion.

Q: What’s your refund policy for the HD Splash Potion?

A: Potions are non-refundable—we’re unable to refund potions after purchase or use.

Q: What happens if a person with low bandwidth is watching my HD Splash Potion stream?

A: The effect of the HD Splash Potion can be impacted by the technical limitations of your or your fellow streamers' device or bandwidth. HD streaming capability may be limited if people watching your stream have low bandwidth or are tuning in from an unsupported device. To ensure that everyone in the call can benefit from the HD Splash Potion, make sure everyone in the call has a strong internet connection and is watching from a desktop device.

articles.name: My Discord Email was Changed and I Want to Undo It
articles.title: My Discord Email was Changed and I Want to Undo It
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • How to Undo an Email Address Change
  • I Got an Error When Trying to Undo My Email Change
  • How Does the Account Recovery Link Actually Work?
Note: Please note that account recovery links will become invalid after a 48 hour time period. Do not share this link to others.

Changing the email on your Discord account is a big deal! That’s why we send you an extra email notification to the original email address after it’s been confirmed. 

This message also includes a button to let you revert or undo the email change within 48 hours, as an extra method to keep you in control of your account.

How to Undo an Email Address Change

Note: The URL will always start with https://discord.com/wasntme/ - anything else is fake and not from Discord!

1. To start, press the button in the email notification we sent you that says Start Account Recovery. 

This link is uniquely generated for your account and is only valid for 48 hours - don’t share it with anyone!

2. After tapping the link, you’ll be taken to an Account Recovery page where you will be able to complete the following:

  • Change your Discord account’s email back to the previous email address
  • Log out the Discord account from all devices
  • Update your password
  • Remove any phone number on the Discord account
  • Remove any Multi-Factor Authentication methods on the Discord account
  • Invalidate existing recovery URLs for email changes to your account made after this one

3. To complete the process, follow the instructions after pressing Start revert process. 

You’ll provide a new password, and then the email address for your Discord account will be reverted to the one we sent the recovery link to - alongside the other changes listed on the page.

Note: If you had a phone number or MFA device enrolled on the account, be sure to add those back after completing the recovery process! For more details, check out the Setting up Multi-Factor Authentication Help Center article.

I Got an Error When Trying to Undo My Email Change

For technical reasons, you’ll only see an error when trying to complete the password reset part of this process, and not before that. 

Common reasons you could see an error here are:

  • It’s been more than 48 hours since we sent you the recovery link, and it’s no longer valid.
  • A recovery has already been performed on this account using a link we sent before the one being used.
  • The email address that the link was sent to is currently in use by another Discord account. To complete the account recovery, ensure that no other Discord accounts are using that email address.
  • The password you’re attempting to set is invalid. For example, we don’t accept passwords less than 8 characters, and some regions may have additional password requirements

Note: If your account recovery link has expired, the Discord support team is not able to send you a new one.

How Does the Account Recovery Link Work?

To ensure the security of the account (and prevent scammers from regaining access to the account after you perform the recovery), the following restrictions are in place for the recovery process:

  • The link is only valid for 48 hours.
  • If multiple recovery links have been generated for an account, using one will invalidate any that were created after the one that was used.
  • Any phone number and MFA devices associated with the account are removed.
  • You are required to change your password during this process (in case someone knows your current password), and the Discord account will be logged out from all devices.
Note: If you’d like to learn more information about compromised or hacked accounts and how to report abusive behavior on Discord, please review our My Discord Account was Hacked or Compromised Help Center article.

articles.name: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2024
articles.title: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2024
articles.body:
Starting from October 17, 2024 (12PM PT) to October 31, 2024 (12PM PT), Twitch users that purchase or gift 1 Twitch subscription in a channel can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 3 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim through Twitch by October 31, 2024 (12PM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Membership: After the 3 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Twitch?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Twitch?

Twitch is an interactive livestreaming service for content spanning gaming, entertainment, sports, music, and more. Learn more by heading to Twitch.tv.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?

Note: The 3 months of Discord Nitro trial can be claimed on Twitch from desktop or mobile devices.

1. After the purchase requirement has been completed, you should receive a notification on Twitch about claiming your code. 

2. If you delete the notification or no longer see it, you can also go to your Twitch Inventory and scroll down until you see the Rewards section. 

3. Tap on Redeem to get the Discord 3 months of Nitro.  

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

Note: This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Note: Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copying and Pasting into your Browser Window

  • Start by directly pressing the promotion link or copying and pasting the promotion link into your browser window.

Note: If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

  • Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.
    • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 
Note: If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Twitch users can claim Discord Nitro promo between October 17, 2024 (12PM PT) to October 31, 2024 (12PM PT).

After November 30, 2024 (12PM PT), Twitch users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by October 31, 2024 (12PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by November 30, 2024 (12PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 3 months of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Twitch account?

A: Available to any purchasers of one (1) new subscription or gift subscription of any tier on any channel on Twitch.tv that has enabled the offer.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 months Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 3 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 3 months.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 3 months perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I’m having trouble with my Twitch account.

A: Reach out to Twitch’s support team through here: https://help.twitch.tv/s/contactsupport

articles.name: How to Cancel your Server Subscription
articles.title: How to Cancel your Server Subscription
articles.body:
Note: If you’re looking to cancel a different subscription. Please check out the corresponding article: Nitro subscription, Server subscription, or Premium App.
What this article covers:
  • How to Cancel Server Subscription on Desktop/Browser
  • How to Cancel Server Subscription on Mobile
  • How Do I Re-Subscribe After Canceling My Subscription?
  • What if I Can’t Access My Discord and Need to Cancel?

Note: If you want to request a refund for your subscription instead, please check out the Refund Policy Help Center article.

You can cancel your Server subscription at any time. Once canceled, your subscription will end at the end of your current billing period. 

Note: Subscriptions need to be canceled on the same device type where the purchase was originally made.

For example:
If you purchased a Server Subscription through the desktop or browser app, you must cancel it through the desktop app or browser.

If you purchased through a mobile device, you can only cancel through a mobile device. If you don’t have access to your device to cancel yourself, please check out this section.

How to Cancel Server Subscription on Desktop/Browser

1. Tap on the cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Then head to the Subscriptions tab.

3. Here you should see a banner for your Server Subscriptions. To cancel, tap on Manage Memberships.

4. Here you will see all of your current Server Subscriptions.

To cancel, tap on the dropdown next to the Server Subscription you want to cancel and then tap on Cancel my Membership.

5. Follow the prompts to fully cancel your Server Subscription.

How to Cancel Server Subscription on Mobile

1. Tap on your avatar in the bottom right.

2. Then, tap on the cogwheel [] in the top right.

3. Next, scroll down to Billing Settings and tap on Manage Nitro. If you don’t have an active Nitro subscription, you’ll need to tap on Get Nitro at the top instead.

4. Here you should see all of your current subscriptions. Next to your Server subscription, tap on Cancel.

5. Now just follow the on-screen device prompts to cancel your subscription.

Once the cancellation has been completed, your Manage Nitro settings will show the date on which your subscription will expire and you will lose your subscription benefits.

Alternatively, you can also cancel your Discord subscriptions directly on your mobile device settings by following these instructions for Apple iOS subscriptions or Google Play subscriptions.

How Do I Re-Subscribe After Canceling My Subscription?

Note: If you’re trying to re-subscribe on your mobile device, the steps might be a little different. Please head to the Manage Nitro tab under your User Settings in order to re-subscribe your subscription.

If you’ve changed your mind and no longer wish for your Server subscription to end at the end of your billing period, then you can always reactivate it. Just make sure you do before the billing period ends, otherwise you’ll just have to purchase a new subscription. Here’s how to re-subscribe:

1. Tap on cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Next, navigate to the Subscriptions tab.

3. Now, tap on Re-Subscribe within the corresponding banner to uncancel your subscription. 

You’ll be able to tell it was reactivated, because you’ll see the banner no longer has Pending Cancellation listed.

What if I Can’t Access my Discord and Need to Cancel?

Note: If your Discord purchase was through an Apple device, please reach out to Apple to cancel your subscription. The Discord Support team is not able to manage your iOS subscription.

If you’re unable to log into your Discord account for any reason and cancel your subscription (for desktop, browser, or even through an Android device) yourself, you can reach out to our Billing Support team under the email address tied to your Discord account and request it to be canceled through here: http://dis.gd/billing. 

If you want to submit a refund request instead, and your purchase is within our Refund Policy, please follow the steps outlined here.

What this article covers:

If you purchased through a mobile device, you can only cancel through a mobile device. If you don’t have access to your device to cancel yourself, please check out this section.

How to Cancel Server Boost Subscription on Desktop/Browser

How to Cancel Server Boost Subscription on Mobile

1. Tap on your avatar in the bottom right.

2. Then, tap on the cogwheel [] in the top right.

3. Next, scroll down to Billing Settings and tap on Manage Nitro. If you don’t have an active Nitro subscription, you’ll need to tap on Get Nitro at the top instead.

4. Here you should see all of your current subscriptions. Next to your Server Boost subscription, tap on Cancel.

5. Now just follow the on-screen device prompts to cancel your subscription.

Once the cancellation has been completed, your Manage Nitro settings will show the date on which your subscription will expire and you will lose your subscription benefits.

Alternatively, you can also cancel your Discord subscriptions directly on your mobile device settings by following these instructions for Apple iOS subscriptions or Google Play subscriptions.

 

How Do I Re-Subscribe After Canceling My Subscription?

Note: If you’re trying to re-subscribe on your mobile device, the steps might be a little different. Please head to the Manage Nitro tab under your User Settings in order to re-subscribe your subscription.

If you’ve changed your mind and no longer wish for your Server Boost subscription to end at the end of your billing period, then you can always reactivate it. Just make sure you do before the billing period ends, otherwise you’ll just have to purchase a new subscription. Here’s how to re-subscribe:

1. Tap on cogwheel [] next to your Discord username to access your User Settings.

2. Next, navigate to the Subscriptions tab.

3. Now, tap on Re-Subscribe within the corresponding banner to uncancel your subscription. 

You’ll be able to tell it was reactivated, because you’ll see the banner no longer has Pending Cancellation listed.

What if I Can’t Access my Discord and Need to Cancel?

Note: If your Discord purchase was through an Apple device, please reach out to Apple to cancel your subscription. The Discord Support team is not able to manage your iOS subscription.

If you’re unable to log into your Discord account for any reason and cancel your subscription (for desktop, browser, or even through an Android device), you can reach out to our Billing Support team with the email address tied to your Discord account and request it to be canceled through this support form: http://dis.gd/billing. 

If you want to submit a refund request instead, and your purchase is within our Refund Policy, please follow the steps outlined in our Refund Policy.

articles.name: How to Fix Phone Errors on Discord
articles.title: How to Fix Phone Errors on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Phone is Already Registered
  • Invalid Phone Number
  • Other Phone Errors

There are some error messages that you might notice when trying to register with, add, or change the phone number on your account. Let’s go over those cases and what to do if you’re experiencing those specific errors.

Before you begin the process of adding a phone number, please make sure you have access to that number and your mobile device.

Phone is Already Registered

A phone can only be registered with one Discord account at a time. If you are encountering an error that states This phone number is unable to be associated with this account, this is because the phone number is already tied to another account. As you can only have one number per account, you would need to remove the number from the other account Discord in order to use it.

Note: If you’re unable to remove the phone number yourself, please check out the How to Remove a Phone Number Help Center article for steps.

Invalid Phone Number

Make sure that the phone number you are entering is properly formatted and is valid according to your country’s numbering plan. 

Also, make sure the phone number is not associated with a landline or VOIP device, and that the number you are trying to use is associated with a mobile device.

Other Errors

If you’re running into any other error messages, or you’re receiving one of the errors above and it’s still not working, please reach out to our Support team for further assistance: https://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Chargebacks FAQ
articles.title: Chargebacks FAQ
articles.body:
Fraudulently issuing chargebacks for purchases made on Discord violates our Terms of Service.

We may suspend accounts following a chargeback being filed to protect your account, our community, or our payment systems from potential abuse or fraud.

To avoid violating this policy, all refund or billing inquiry requests should be directed to our support team at dis.gd/billing instead.⁠⁠

However, if your account has been suspended for this violation, you may appeal the suspension by submitting an appeal to Discord's Trust & Safety Team at dis.gd/request.

What this article covers:
  • What is a Chargeback
  • What This Policy States
  • How to Avoid Violating This Policy
  • How to Appeal a Chargeback Ban on Your Account

What is a Chargeback

A chargeback occurs when a transaction is reported to a payment issuer as incorrect or unrecognized.

Filing a chargeback against a transaction made on Discord may result in account suspension pending further investigation on our end. This suspension is in line with Discord’s Terms of Service which prohibits actions that may cause harm to Discord and others.

This policy aims to maintain a safe and secure environment for our community while preventing potential abuse or fraud through our payment systems.

What This Policy States

Don’t use the services to do harm to Discord. 

Among other things, this includes trying to gain access to or attacking our systems, scraping our services without our written consent, transmitting viruses or other malicious code to our services, abusing or defrauding us or our payment systems, copying our product or using our intellectual property without permission, and misusing our reporting or customer service mechanisms.

How to Avoid Violating This Policy

We take violations of this policy seriously due to the potential harm they may cause to Discord and others. Discord's right to terminate an account following such a violation is stated in our Terms of Service. 

If you require a refund due to a payment issue or unrecognized activity, or if you have any billing questions, please contact our support team at dis.gd/billing. Our team will assist you according to our policies and guidelines.

How to Appeal a Chargeback Ban on Your Account

We value transparency and are committed to protecting Discord and others from harm. If your account has been suspended due to a violation of this policy, you can appeal the enforcement action taken through our support form.

On the form, select “Appeal an action taken on my account or bot” from the “How can we help?” dropdown menu.

In the “What would you like to appeal?” section, select “An action taken on my account”.

To assist with our investigation, please provide the following information in your appeal:

  • The reason the chargeback was filed
  • If applicable, evidence of chargeback claim withdrawal
  • Screenshot of the disputed transaction on your billing statement.
    • Please ensure the screenshot displays the amount and date of transaction along with the descriptor.
Important:
  • We do not accept Discord receipts as proof as payment and this screenshot must be directly from the payment source.
  • Please note that all data associated with accounts suspended for chargebacks is deleted or anonymized 90 days after the suspension process begins.
  • If you submit your appeal after this 90-day period, we will no longer have any record of the account's existence and, consequently, will be unable to process your appeal.

articles.name: iOS Purchases on Discord FAQ
articles.title: iOS Purchases on Discord FAQ
articles.body:
What this article covers: 

  • iOS Purchases on Discord
  • Frequently Asked Questions

iOS Purchases on Discord

When making most purchases on Discord via iOS, there are a few important considerations to keep in mind.
Most Discord subscriptions bought through iOS (such as a Nitro, Nitro gifting, or Server Boost) or the Apple App Store are linked to your Apple ID. This is similar to how purchases work with the Google Play Store. Here's what you need to know:

  • The Discord account used for the first-time purchase of a subscription will link to the Apple ID used for the purchase.
  • Future iOS subscriptions will automatically apply to that same Discord account.
  • You cannot purchase or manage multiple subscriptions for two different Discord accounts through iOS.

If you want to purchase a Discord subscription on iOS for a different account than the one linked to your Apple account, there are a few options:

  • Try using a different device or Discord platform, such as the desktop app, to purchase the subscription on the secondary Discord account. 
  • If you're not using your original Discord account, you can cancel the subscription tied to it and delete the account. Once both steps are complete, you will be able to use your Apple ID on the new account. Please note: the account deletion process will take up to 15 days to complete. '
Note: Discord is unable to assist with Apple subscription issues. Discord subscriptions purchased through the Apple App Store can only be managed in your Apple settings. Users can't manage these subscriptions via desktop, browser, or Android.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How do I know if my subscription is managed through Apple? 

A: To check if Apple manages your Discord subscription on your iOS device, follow the steps on Apple's official website: https://support.apple.com/guide/iphone/view-or-cancel-subscriptions-iph4e3e7324f/ios. 

To review your subscription on Discord, head into to your User Settings in the desktop/browser Discord app by selecting the cogwheel icon [] in the bottom-right corner of the app. Once there, navigate to Subscriptions where you will find you are able to review your subscription details. 

Example of Apple managed subscription within Discord

Q: What should I do if my Discord purchase made via iOS is marked as Past Due?

A: If your Discord purchase made via iOS is marked as Past Due, try these steps:

  • Verify that the billing address for the charged card is up-to-date and matches your bank's information.
  • Double-check that your card details are entered correctly.
  • Make sure the card hasn't expired.
  • Ensure there are sufficient funds in the account or that you haven't exceeded the credit limit.
  • Check if you've reached a pre-set spending limit on the card.

If you're still having trouble processing your subscription renewal after trying these steps, contact Apple's Support team. Visit the Apple Support page and log in with the Apple ID you used for the purchase.

Q: I purchased a subscription (Nitro, Server Boosts, etc.) on my Apple device and would like a refund. What should I do?

A: We are unable to process refunds for Discord purchases through iOS, including Nitro, Nitro Classic, Nitro Basic, gift subscriptions, and premium apps. For further assistance, please contact Apple Support by visiting https://reportaproblem.apple.com and logging in with the Apple ID used to make your purchase(s). For more information about both refund policies, please see Discord’s refund policy, and Apple’s refund policy. 

Q: I made a Server Subscription purchase via iOS and would like a refund. What should I do? 

A: Discord’s support team can help refund a Server Subscription purchase if the request was made within 5 days from your initial purchase date. Additionally, Server Subscription refunds are a one-time only exception. To submit a refund request, head over to dis.gd/support to submit a ticket.  

Q: My friend gave me a gift credit, but I have an active subscription managed through iOS. What should I do?

A: Please be aware that gift credits cannot be redeemed on mobile devices. 

To use the gift credit, you will need to cancel your current subscription through your Apple device. Note that subscriptions do not end immediately; they will terminate at the end of the current billing period. Once your subscription has ended, you can redeem your gift credit by subscribing to a matching subscription using the web or desktop client. 

Q: I purchased a Nitro subscription and it's not appearing or working. What should I do?

A: If you purchased a subscription directly from the Apple App Store via your Apple device, the purchase should appear under the Discord account associated with your Apple ID. Check the User Settings > Billing tab within the Discord account you originally made purchases on.   

Q: I purchased Nitro Basic and now I want to upgrade to Nitro or add additional Server Boosts to my Server Boost subscription purchased through the Apple App Store. How can I do this?

A: To upgrade your subscription from Nitro Basic to Nitro, you'll need to manage it through your Apple device. Follow these steps:

1. Open your Settings.

2. Select Apple ID.

3. Go to Subscriptions.

4. Tap on the active subscription.

5. Select “See all Plan Types” and select the subscription you wish to have. 

If you encounter any issues with your subscription or the upgrade process, please contact Apple Support for further assistance.

Q: I’m trying to make a Discord purchase through my Apple device and it’s not working. What should I do?

A: If you're experiencing issues while attempting to make a Discord purchase on your Apple device, we recommend trying to complete the purchase on the Desktop or Web client instead. If using a different device is not an option, the problem might be related to the Apple App Store. In this case, please contact Apple Support for further assistance.

articles.name: How to Screen Share on MacOS
articles.title: How to Screen Share on MacOS
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is Screen Sharing?
  • How to Screen Share on MacOS

What is Screen Sharing?

Note: To learn more about screen sharing, please check out the Go Live and Screen Share Help Center article. If you’d rather use a Stage Channel for screen sharing, please check out the Stage Channels FAQ Help Center article.

Screen Sharing allows you to share your screen or an application window through a voice call in a server, direct message, or group message. 

Note: When you’re in a voice call, any number of users can screen share, but only 50 users can watch an individual screen share.

How to Screen Share on MacOS

Note: Depending on the OS of your Mac device, your UI may look slightly different.

1. Join a voice channel that you have permissions to screen share in and then tap the Screen Share [] icon.

2. You can choose to share one of the following: Share entire screen, share a window, share an app, or you can tap on Or share a device to share from a device.

3. After deciding what you want to screen share, you can then select the Stream Quality, Resolution, and Frame Rate. After you’re finished with your selections, tap on Next.

4. You’ll be prompted by your MacOS device to select exactly what you want to screenshare. Tap Make Selection and then press on what you want to share to select it.

5. Now you’re screen sharing to the Discord app on a MacOS device!

articles.name: Message Bookmarks and Reminders
articles.title: Message Bookmarks and Reminders
articles.body:
NOTE: This feature is currently experimental and available to a limited number of Nitro members.

What this article covers: 

  • What are Bookmarks? 
  • Bookmark a Message
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile
  • Creating a Reminder
    • Desktop/Browser
    • Mobile

What are Bookmarks?

Discord's bookmarks feature is here to transform how you manage your conversations via chat, direct messages (DM), and group chats. Available exclusively for Nitro users, this tool allows you to:

  • Easily save important messages for later reference
  • Organize your Discord content more efficiently
  • Manage your saved items in real-time, with the ability to save or unsave messages as needed
NOTE: Bookmarks have a storage limit of 200 messages.

Never miss crucial information again! With bookmarks, you can keep track of important conversations and come back to them whenever you need.

Bookmark a Message

NOTE: As this feature is experimental, the steps may vary slightly. 

Bookmarking messages allows you to bookmark important information for easy access later. Whether you're using Discord on desktop, browser, or mobile, here's how you can bookmark messages:

Desktop/Browser

1. On desktop or browser, navigate to the message you would like to save. 

2. Right-click the message and select the Bookmark Message option in the dropdown menu, then press Bookmark. 

3. Once bookmarked, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been saved for later. 

4. To view your bookmarked messages, press the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app and select the Bookmarks tab to find your messages. 

On desktop/browser: To convert a bookmarked message into a reminder or unsave it, press the Inbox icon [] > Bookmarks tab. Then select the desired option in the upper right-corner of the bookmarked message.

Mobile

1. On mobile, navigate to the message you would like to save. 

2. Long-press the message and tap Bookmark Message in the menu. 

3. Once bookmarked, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been saved for later. 

 

4. To view your bookmarked messages, tap Notifications [] located in the bottom hub and select the Bookmarks icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app. This will take you to the Bookmarks tab.    

 

 

On mobile: To convert a bookmarked message into a reminder or unsave it, navigate to Notifications [] > Bookmarks[]. Then tap the ellipsis [] in the upper-right corner of the message and select the desired option.  

Creating a Reminder

Reminders allow you to set notifications for important messages at a specific time.Here's how to create reminders on both desktop, browser, and mobile:

Desktop/Browser

1. On desktop or browser, select the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app.

2. Hover over the message you would like to set as a reminder and press the Create Reminder icon [] in the upper-right corner of the message.

3. In the Remind Me menu, you can choose how long you’d like to wait before being reminded. 

Choosing the Custom option in the Remind Me menu allows you to set a specific date and time for your reminder.

4. To view your reminders, press the Inbox icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app and select the Bookmarks tab. Here, you’ll find your added reminders. Each reminder will display your chosen Due in timeframe above the message. 

On desktop/browser: To edit, complete, or remove the reminder, right-click the message you have set as a reminder within Inbox > Bookmarks. From there, choose your desired action. 

Mobile 

1. On mobile, navigate to the message you would like to set as a reminder. 

2. Long-press the message and tap Create Reminder in the menu. 

3. Choose when you would like to be reminded in the Remind Me… menu. 

 

4. Once set, you will see a notification badge letting you know that the message has been set as a reminder. 

5. To view your reminders, tap Notifications [] located in the bottom hub and select the Bookmarks icon [] in the upper-right corner of the app.  

   

On mobile: To edit or remove the reminder, tap the ellipsis [] in the upper-right corner of the reminder, then select the desired option. Tap the checkmark icon [] to mark it as complete.

articles.name: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.title: Using an Authenticator App on Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is an Authenticator App?
  • How to Register an Authenticator App 
    • Mobile
    • Desktop/Browser
  • Logging in With an Authenticator App

What is an Authenticator App?

Using an Authenticator App (also called a Time-based One-Time Password or TOTP) is another great way to secure your account by providing a one-time code alongside your password - this ensures that someone can’t log into your account if they only have your password. You can set up an Authenticator App from your Account Settings on the mobile, desktop, and browser app.
